author: Muskan Kumawat
title: Citizenship Amendment Act will be implemented before Lok Sabha elections, know more about the act
content: The rules of 'Citizenship Amendment Act' (CAA) will come into force before the Lok Sabha elections in the country. Trusted sources of the Central Government have given this information on Tuesday. The Union Home Ministry has completed its homework on this matter. CAA rules may come into effect in January or February. Under the rules of the Citizenship Amendment Act, the rules for obtaining Indian citizenship will become easier for non-Muslim immigrants from India's three Muslim neighbouring countries, which include Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh. These six communities include Hindus, Christians, Sikhs, Jains, Buddhists and Parsis.              The Citizenship Amendment Bill was passed by the Parliament on December 11, 2019. This bill got the assent of the President just a day later. Through CAA, it will be easier for minorities belonging to Hindu, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist, Parsi and Christian communities from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan to get Indian citizenship. Such minorities have entered India on or before December 31, 2014. Earlier, to acquire Indian citizenship, a person was required to live in India for at least 11 years. This rule has been simplified under the Citizenship Amendment Act 2019. The period for acquiring citizenship has been increased from 1 to 6 years.This law has not been implemented yet because rules are yet to be made under the CAA. The Parliamentary Committees on Subordinate Legislation in Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha had given extensions to the Union Home Ministry till December 31, 2022 and January 9, 2023, respectively. After this, the parliamentary committees again approved the expansion.              There were sharp reactions in the country regarding CAA. Many political parties also opposed it. At that time the central government had decided to implement it, but due to Corona, CAA remained in limbo. More than 200 public interest litigations were filed in the Supreme Court in this matter. Amidst all this, Union Home Minister Amit Shah kept saying that CAA would be implemented in every situation. There has been a delay in implementing this Act due to the Covid-19 pandemic. Those who think this will not happen will be proven wrong.CAA, in itself, does not give citizenship to any person. Through this, the eligible person becomes eligible to apply. This law will apply to those who came to India from Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh on or before December 31, 2014. In this, the migrants will have to prove the period for which they have stayed in India. They will also have to prove that they have come to India due to religious persecution from their countries. They speak the languages which are included in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution. They will also have to fulfil the requirements of the Third Schedule of the Civil Code 1955. Only after this, the migrants will be eligible to apply.                         The Citizenship Amendment Bill was passed by the Parliament on December 11, 2019. This bill got the assent of the President just a day later. Through CAA, it will be easier for minorities belonging to Hindu, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist, Parsi and Christian communities from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan to get Indian citizenship. Such minorities have entered India on or before December 31, 2014. Earlier, to acquire Indian citizenship, a person was required to live in India for at least 11 years. This rule has been simplified under the Citizenship Amendment Act 2019. The period for acquiring citizenship has been increased from 1 to 6 years.This law has not been implemented yet because rules are yet to be made under the CAA. Only after this, the migrants will be eligible to apply.                         This law has not been implemented yet because rules are yet to be made under the CAA. author: Muskan Kumawat
title: Rain spoiled Mitchell Santner's hard work, Bangladesh won the third T20I, the series ended on a draw
content: These days the New Zealand team is playing the T20 series against Bangladesh. The New Zealand team won the toss in the third T20 and decided to bowl first. Batting first, Bangladesh set a target of 110 runs for New Zealand.              The team lost its first wicket in the form of Soumya Sarkar for 1 run in the first over. After this, the team lost the second wicket for 31 runs. Captain Nazmul Hussain Shanto scored the maximum 17 runs for the team. Tauheed Hridoy scored 16 runs and Afif Hussain scored 14 runs.Apart from this, Ronnie Talukdar and Rishad Hussain scored 10 runs each. Apart from this, no batsman could cross the double figure. In bowling, Mitchell Santner took 4 wickets for 16 runs. Apart from this, Tim Southee, Adam Milne and Ben Sears took 2-2 wickets.              The New Zealand team, which came to chase 110 runs, lost its wicket for 16 runs. Finn Allen scored the maximum 38 runs for the team. Apart from this, James Neesham scored 28 not out and captain Mitchell Santner scored 18 not out. With this, 4 batsmen of the team returned to the pavilion in 1 run.The New Zealand team could score only 95 runs after losing 5 wickets in 14.4 overs. Mahedi Hasan and Shoriful Islam of Bangladesh took 2 wickets each. Bangladesh once again achieved a spectacular victory in the third match due to DLS due to rain. In such a situation, Bangladesh won the third match and drew the series. The second match was tied due to rain. The first match was won by New Zealand. Batting first, the Bangladesh team set a target of 110 runs. Due to rain, the New Zealand team could score only 95 runs in 14 overs due to DLS. Due to this, the series was drawn 1-1.

author: Muskan Kumawat
title: Shakib Al Hasan suffered a big loss due to weak eyesight in the World Cup 2023, Bangladeshi captain's revelation surprised the cricket world
content: Bangladesh team captain Shakib Al Hasan has recently made a big revelation. Shakib Al Hasan said that he could not bat well in the ODI World Cup 2023 due to weak eyesight.              He said that due to this he suffered a huge loss. There was a lot of discussion about the batting of Bangladesh's star all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan. According to a Cricbuzz report, Shakib revealed that he was struggling with eyesight problems during the World Cup 2023, but he still played in the tournament.Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan has recently revealed that he was batting with poor eyesight throughout the World Cup 2023. Let us tell you that Shakib returned to Bangladesh in the middle of the World Cup. Where he met his childhood mentor Nazmul Abedin and had a long batting session with him. However, when he returned, no change was seen in his batting.              Shakib said that he had also gone to the doctor regarding this problem, where he came to know that there was water in the retina or cornea of his eye. The doctor gave him eye drops and advised him to reduce stress. However, Shakib did not realize that all this had happened due to stress. After this, he continued playing in the World Cup 2023, but he could not do anything special with the bat.In the World Cup played on Indian soil, Shakib played all the matches with poor eyesight and in the entire tournament he scored only 186 runs at an average of 26.6. At the same time, he also took 9 wickets.After the World Cup 2023, when Shakib went to London to get his eyes checked, he came to know that it was not due to stress. Recently, Shakib Al Hasan has been ruled out of the Test series against New Zealand because he has injured his finger.                         He said that due to this he suffered a huge loss. author: Muskan Kumawat
title: Boat filled with 142 Rohingya reached Andaman Nicobar, people on board the boat included 47 women and 59 minors
content: A boat carrying 142 suspected Rohingya refugees was intercepted by coastal security agencies in Andaman Nicobar Islands on Sunday. Police said that the boat had left Bangladesh about 14-15 days ago and was going to Indonesia. Officials said that on Sunday morning, the Port Blair police control room received information from the local intelligence about the movement of a suspicious boat near Shaheed Island.              After this, several coastal security agencies including the Navy, Coast Guard and Marine Police swung into action. The boat was stopped after action was taken by the agencies. The people on board the boat included 47 women and 59 minors. The boat was towed to Shaheed Dweep by the marine police as it had developed some technical snag and was not fit for further travel, police said.He said all the Rohingyas were taken to Port Blair and kept in a temporary shelter by the local administration pending further instructions from the central government. Earlier on February 13, a motorboat carrying 69 Rohingyas had reached the Nicobar district. Officials said it was going to Indonesia, but stopped here due to bad weather.               After this, several coastal security agencies including the Navy, Coast Guard and Marine Police swung into action. The boat was stopped after action was taken by the agencies. The people on board the boat included 47 women and 59 minors. The boat was towed to Shaheed Dweep by the marine police as it had developed some technical snag and was not fit for further travel, police said.He said all the Rohingyas were taken to Port Blair and kept in a temporary shelter by the local administration pending further instructions from the central government. Earlier on February 13, a motorboat carrying 69 Rohingyas had reached the Nicobar district. Officials said it was going to Indonesia, but stopped here due to bad weather.               He said all the Rohingyas were taken to Port Blair and kept in a temporary shelter by the local administration pending further instructions from the central government. Earlier on February 13, a motorboat carrying 69 Rohingyas had reached the Nicobar district. Officials said it was going to Indonesia, but stopped here due to bad weather.
content_summary: Andaman Nicobar: A boat carrying 142 suspected Rohingya refugees was stopped by coastal security agencies in Andaman Nicobar Islands on Sunday. Police said that the boat had left Bangladesh about 14-15 days ago and was going to Indonesia. The people on board the boat found off Andaman and Nicobar Islands include 47 women and 59 minors.

author: Muskan Kumawat
title: NZ vs BAN: Bangladesh created history in ODI, defeated New Zealand at home for the first time
content: In the last match of the three-match ODI series played between Bangladesh and New Zealand, the Bangladeshi team created history by defeating the Kiwis by 9 wickets. This is the first time in the history of cricket that the Bangladesh team has defeated New Zealand in an ODI at its own home. In this match, the New Zealand team, batting first, was limited to just 98 runs in 31.4 overs. After this, the Bangladesh team registered a big victory by achieving the target in the 16th over itself at the loss of one wicket.              This match between Bangladesh and New Zealand was played at McLean Park in Napier. Bangladesh won the toss and decided to bowl first, which proved to be right for them. Bangladesh bowled out New Zealand for just 98 runs in 31.4 overs after coming to bat first. The Kiwi team's opener Will Young played the highest innings of 26 runs. Apart from Young, Tom Latham played an inning of 21 runs. Apart from this, no batsman could reach the score of 20. Shoriful Islam, Soumya Sarkar and Tanzeem Hasan Shakib took 3 wickets each for Bangladesh.Chasing the target of 99 runs, the Bangladesh team won the match in 15.1 overs at the loss of one wicket. There was a 15-run partnership for the first wicket between Soumya Sarkar and Anamul Haq when Soumya retired hurt. After this, there was a partnership of 69 runs in 50 balls for the second wicket between Nazmul Hussain Shanto and Haq. Anamul was out after scoring 37 runs on the last ball of the 13th over. Then Liton Das, who came at number four, played an unbeaten inning of 1 run and Nazmul Hussain Shanto led Bangladesh to victory by playing an unbeaten inning of 51 runs.              Host New Zealand may have won the three-match ODI series 2-1, but by winning the last match, Bangladesh has spoiled the victory of the Kiwi team. This victory was historic for Bangladesh. This is the first time that Bangladesh has registered its first ODI win against New Zealand at home. This is the first time in the history of cricket that the Bangladesh team has defeated New Zealand in an ODI at its own home.

author: Muskan Kumawat
title: BSF: Special marine battalion will be formed to stop terrorist infiltration in Sundarban, powerful drones will be deployed
content: BSF has decided to form a special marine battalion and deploy powerful drones in the Sunderbans located on the India-Bangladesh international border. The BSF has planned to deploy a marine battalion of over 1,100 personnel, a squadron of around 40 drones, and 12-14 all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) to ensure security and prevent infiltration and smuggling in the strategically important and swampy Sundarban mangrove area. Have planned.              Sources said that the blueprint of the plan has been prepared by the BSF's Eastern Command Headquarters in Kolkata and the final approval and financial sanction is awaited from the Union Home Ministry. The Sundarbans, the world's largest mangrove forest area, are a group of more than 100 islands. Spread over an area of 9,630 square km in India, adjacent to the Bangladesh border, this area is a complex system of drains, rivers, and creeks.The remaining part of Sundarban comes under Bangladesh. It is situated on the delta of Ganga, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers on the banks of the Bay of Bengal. A senior official said that Sundarban is a strategic and important area on the India-Bangladesh border. Its effective control and security are the need of the hour as this inaccessible forest and river area can be used by terrorists and criminals for infiltration.              That is why BSF has decided to raise special marine battalions and deploy powerful drones that can conduct long-range surveillance. There are also plans to deploy some ATVs to reach these areas for better patrolling. BSF has sought permission from the Bengal government to deploy its patrolling teams in the forest department outposts located in the Sundarbans. Sources said that the blueprint of the plan has been prepared by the BSF's Eastern Command Headquarters in Kolkata and the final approval and financial sanction is awaited from the Union Home Ministry. Sundarbans is the largest mangrove forest area in the world.

author: Muskan Kumawat
title: 'Because of Congress, Bangladeshi tag was placed on our forehead' AIUDF chief Badruddin Ajmal lashed out over NRC
content: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) president Badruddin Ajmal has held Congress responsible for the problems faced by the public due to the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the state.              Badruddin Ajmal, Lok Sabha MP from Assam's Dhubri constituency, said it is because of the Congress that many people in the state are being labelled as 'Bangladeshis'."We are not Bangladeshis, who built the detention camp here, it was Congress, it was Congress who created the NRC problem," Badruddin Ajmal said at a party meeting held in Assam's Dhubri district on Saturday. It is Congress that has put a Bangladeshi tag on our forehead.              Ajmal further said 'If Congress does not form an alliance with AIUDF then Congress will be destroyed in Assam. They will keep facing defeat after defeat and they will end up here.On next year's Lok Sabha elections, Badruddin Ajmal said that AIUDF will perform well in the elections. He said, 'AIUDF will perform well in the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. Nagaon, Karimganj and Dhubri Lok Sabha constituencies have become favourable for us, we will contest these seats and win. As per the Assam Accord of August 15, 1985, the exercise of the National Register of Citizens (NRC) has been started in the state. author: Muskan Kumawat
title: AUS vs BAN: Australia won the toss and chose bowling, Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Starc out of the team
content: The 43rd match of the league matches of the World Cup 2023 is being played between five-time champions Australia and Bangladesh. In this match being played at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune, Australia captain Pat Cummins won the toss and decided to bowl first. The decision of this match will not make any difference in the points table. In such a situation, this competition is just a formality.              Australia has made two changes in its playing 11. All-rounder Glenn Maxwell, who scored a double century in the last match, has been rested in this match. Apart from him, fast bowler Mitchell Starc is also not playing in this match. In place of these two, Shawn Abbott and Steve Smith have returned to the team. At the same time, Bangladesh was forced to make a change in its playing 11. The team's regular captain Shakib Al Hasan is not playing in this match due to an injury. Nasum Ahmed has got a chance in his place.Playing 11 of both the teams -   Bangladesh: Nazmul Hossain Shanto (captain), Tanjeed Hasan, Liton Das, Mahmudullah, Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Tauheed Hridoy, Mehdi Hasan Miraj, Mehdi Hasan, Nasum Ahmed, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman.Australia: Pat Cummins (captain), David Warner, Travis Head, Mitchell Marsh, Steve Smith, Marnus Labuschagne, Josh Inglis (wicketkeeper), Marcus Stoinis, Shaun Abbott, Adam Zampa, Josh Hazlewood. content_summary: Australia vs Bangladesh, World Cup 2023: Australia won the toss and decided to bowl first. Cummins has made two changes in the playing-11. He has rested Maxwell and Starc before the semi-finals. Steve Smith and Shaun Abbott have returned in their place. At the same time, Bangladesh is being captained by Nazmul Hussain Shanto. Shakib is not playing due to a fracture.

author: Muskan Kumawat
title: 'I was in the war, did what I felt was right', Shakib Al Hasan's strong counterattack on Angelo Mathews' time out controversy
content: The 38th match of the World Cup 2023 played between Bangladesh and Sri Lanka at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi on Monday became memorable due to the controversy. The experienced Sri Lankan all-rounder became the first cricketer to be timed out in international cricket.              After this, Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan became the target of criticism and his sportsmanship is being criticized a lot. However, Shakib Al Hasan has no qualms about appealing for time out against Mathews. He said that he does not know whether this is right or not, but it is within the law.I felt like I was at war. Whatever I had to do, I did it. There will be a debate on this. Time out helped us, I will not ignore it. One of our fielders came to me and said that if you appeal, the law says he is out because he did not take his guard in time.              So then I appealed to the umpires. The umpire told me that if I gave out and you called the batsman back, it would not look good. I said I would not call him back. It is in the rules that the batsman has to come to the crease before the stipulated time and Mathews had not come till then.The defeat against Bangladesh proved bad for Sri Lanka in many ways. His troubles have increased. The Sri Lankan team is completely out of the race for the semi-finals of the World Cup 2023. Apart from this, his difficulties in qualifying for the Champions Trophy have also increased.The Sri Lankan team has slipped to eighth place in the points table after the defeat against Bangladesh. He has to play his last match against New Zealand on Thursday. author: Muskan Kumawat
title: PAK vs BAN: Bangladesh won the toss and chose to bat, these 3 big changes happened in Pakistan team
content: The 31st match of the World Cup 2023 is being played today between Pakistan and Bangladesh at the Eden Gardens Stadium in Kolkata. Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan has won the toss and decided to bat first. Babar Azam said that we also wanted to bat first. He said that three changes have been made in the Pakistan team. Imam-ul-Haq, Shadab Khan, and Nawaz have been dropped, while in their place Fakhar Zaman, Agha Salman, and Usama Mir have been included in the playing eleven.              Talking about the head-to-head record of Pakistan and Bangladesh in ODI, a total of 38 matches have been played between the two so far. Out of these, Pakistan team has won 33 matches while the Bangladesh team has been successful in only 5 matches. At the same time, so far 2 matches have been played between Pakistan and Bangladesh in the World Cup and both have won one match each.Pakistan's playing eleven: Abdullah Shafiq, Fakhar Zaman, Babar Azam (captain), Mohammad Rizwan (wicketkeeper), Saud Shakeel, Iftikhar Ahmed, Agha Salman, Shaheen Afridi, Usama Mir, Mohammad Wasim Jr., Haris Rauf.              Playing XI of Bangladesh: Liton Das, Tanjeed Hasan, Nazmul Hossain Shanto, Shakib Al Hasan (captain), Mushfiqur Rahim (wicketkeeper), Mahmudullah, Tauheed Hridoy, Mehdi Hasan Miraj, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman, Shoriful Islam.
